text: was a Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Kuwahara was born in Hiroshima on December 22, 1942. After graduating from Chuo University, he joined his local club Toyo Industries in 1965. The club won Japan Soccer League champions 5 times (1965, 1966, 1967, 1968 and 1970). The club also won 1965, 1967 and 1969 Emperor's Cup. He retired in 1972. He played 94 games and scored 53 goals in the league. In December 1966, Kuwahara was selected the Japan national team for 1966 Asian Games. At this competition, on December 14, he debuted against Malaysia. In 1968, he was selected Japan for 1968 Summer Olympics in Mexico City. He played 2 matches and Japan won Bronze Medal. In 2018, this team was selected Japan Football Hall of Fame. He played 12 games and scored 5 goals for Japan until 1970. On March 1, 2017, Kuwahara died of pneumonia in Hiroshima at the age of 74. ==Statistics== |- |1965||rowspan="8"|Toyo Industries||rowspan="8"|JSL Division 1||13||7 |- |1966||14||9 |- |1967||13||11 |- |1968||14||8 |- |1969||?||5 |- |1970||14||9 |- |1971||?||4 |- |1972||?||0 94||53 94||53 |} Japan National Football Team Database |- |1966||4||2 |- |1967||1||1 |- |1968||2||1 |- |1969||4||1 |- |1970||1||0 |- !Total||12||5 |} ==References== ==Other websites== * *Japan Football Hall of Fame (Japan team at 1968 Olympics) at Japan Football Association Category:1942 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Footballers from Hiroshima Prefecture Category:Japan international footballers Category:Japan Soccer League players Category:Sanfrecce Hiroshima players Category:Footballers at the 1968 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic medalists in football Category:Olympic bronze medalists for Japan Category:Medalists at the 1968 Summer Olympics
title: Yasuyuki Kuwahara
